You can set a project icon too
By creating a PNG image in the project_icons directory of your installation, with the same name as the project key, this image will be shown next to your project throughout The Bug Genie. We recommend images are 16x16 in size. For further information please see the documentation.

This is a part of all urls referring to this project
See about issue prefixes for an explanation about issue prefixes
When you are done, click "Save" to save your changes
Whether or not developers can change details on an issue without marking themselves as working on the issue
You can set issues to be automatically assigned to users depending on the leader set for editions, components and projects. If you wish to use this feature you can turn it on here.
If this project has regular new main- or test-releases, you should enable releases
If the project has more than one edition which differ in features or capabilities, you should enable editions
If the project consists of several easily identifiable sub-parts, you should enable components
When you are done, click "Save" to save your changes
  • Editions
  • Components
  • Releases

These permissions control what you can do, and which pages you can access in The Bug Genie - on a project-specific basis. Some of these permissions are also available as site-wide permissions in the permissions configuration page.

  • Sample project 1 sampleproject1
    • Can see that project exists
      Please see ConfigurePermissions for more information about how permissions work in general.
      Users / groups / teams Can
      Global (Everyone with access)
      Group: Administrators
      Group: Regular users
      Group: Guests
      Team: Staff members
      Team: Developers
      Team: Team leaders
      Team: Testers
      Team: Translators

      Please see ConfigurePermissions for more information about how permissions work in general.
